summary: Email chain between a DOJ OIG Special Agent and a contractor program manager regarding the delayed installation of surveillance cameras at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The correspondence discusses contract details, delivery of equipment in late 2018, and the installation occurring only after an unspecified 'incident'.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: Contractor employee for Convergint Federal/SigNet Technologies who managed the camera procurement and installation contract for the MCC New York. He provides tracking information and explains delays in the installation process.

persons.name: Steve Smith
persons.role: Special Agent, U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General
persons.context: DOJ OIG Special Agent from the New York Field Office who is investigating or inquiring about the camera installation timeline at MCC New York.

connections.description: Special Agent Smith is requesting information from contractor Houston regarding the delivery and installation timeline of surveillance cameras at MCC New York.

events.title: Purchase Order Received for MCC Cameras
events.description: Contractor Convergint Federal received a purchase order for surveillance camera equipment for MCC New York.

events.title: IP Address Request Submitted
events.description: Justin Houston sent paperwork for the MCC site to submit for the IP addresses needed to install the camera system.

events.title: Authorization to Proceed with Original Order
events.description: An unidentified MCC official called Justin Houston and authorized proceeding with the original camera order, after previously requesting a hold and a modification.

events.title: Camera Installation After Incident
events.description: The camera gear was finally installed at MCC New York after an unspecified 'incident'. The equipment had been delivered approximately 30 days after the PO in 2018 but could not be installed until later.

keyFacts: Surveillance camera equipment for MCC New York was ordered and delivered in late 2018 but was not installed until after an unspecified 'incident' occurred.
The installation was delayed because the necessary IP addresses for the network were never provided to the contractor.
An MCC official initially asked to hold the order, then requested changes requiring a contract modification, but ultimately authorized the original order on August 19, 2019.
The email chain is part of a DOJ Office of the Inspector General inquiry into the camera installation timeline at the facility.
